## What's Language Policy?

--

- Linguistic standardization (*what should governments speak?*)
    + Language education (*what should teachers speak?*)

--

- Linguistic ecology (*what should be spoken to non-official-language speakers?*)

--

- Not necessarily national

.center[<img src="image/usaLang.png" height = 350 />]


???

Red: English only

Blue: English plus

Yellow: Bilingual

White: None (Nevada[nəˈvɑd ə])

## Typology

--

Dimension I: <span style="color:red">Number</span> of official languages

--

* Monolingualism vs. Multilingualism

--

Dimension II: <span style="color:red">Nativity</span> of official languages

--

* Mother tongue vs. Lingua franca


???


Mono: Korea

background-image: url(image/theory1.png)

???

Power sharing: 1 + the dominant group

Power neutralizing: 1 + lingua franca

Power sharing: N + native languages

Neutralized-sharing: N + lingua franca + native languages
